Job Title: Program Manager Business Process Transformation

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job Type

Full-time

Description

Many companies offer payroll and human capital management (HCM) solutions, but Paylocity takes technology to the next level. We’ve evolved beyond HCM to a next-generation employee experience platform. With uniquely designed solutions to help companies engage employees, we’ve changed how and where work gets done and created a personalized work environment. Join Paylocity as we continue to transform the future of technology!

We give our employees what they need to succeed, including great benefits and perks! We offer medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and a 401(k) match, as well as perks that support you, your family, and your finances. And if it’s career development you desire, we provide that, too! At Paylocity, people matter most and have always been at the heart of our business.

Help our award-winning technology company run effectively as you take on big challenges and find solutions with a position in Operations.

Use your problem-solving skills to shape the way others see Paylocity. Launch your career with us!

Position Overview

The program manager drives successful completion of strategic cross-functional transformational initiatives and programs by leading and tracking progress toward critical milestones throughout the planning, scheduling, and client service experience. This is accomplished individually or through his / her team. The program manager focuses on a portfolio of internal projects, typically from initiation through delivery, by coordinating with stakeholders and cross-functional team members through meetings and progress measurement activity. The program manager is responsible for maintaining and reporting financial aspects inclusive of cost, budget, and ROI for the portfolio. Projects may be driven, in part, using feedback from customers. Utilizes well developed interpersonal and influencing skills in meeting objectives.

Primary Responsibilities

The below represents the primary duties of the position, others may be assigned as needed. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

A program manager is responsible for running complex programs and projects, personally or through his / her team that is assigned to projectsManages program portfolios from inception through completion, including defining the business case, creating objectives, planning, facilitating working sessions, driving, and overseeing the progress of cross-functional teams, tracking project deliverables and deadlines, identifying dependencies and project risks, and publishing project status reportsPrepare regular progress reports inclusive of financial aspect, to be presented to senior leadership.Engages and motivates key partners to ensure completion of objectives, without direct management responsibility.Execute against program strategies for transformational programsImplements new operational tools and enhancement to existing tools to enable operational effectivenessAnalyzes performance metrics and client feedback to identify improvement opportunitiesCreates solutions which improve business performance and efficiencyBuilds client service strategies and educates stakeholdersLeads and facilitates improvement programs using appropriate methodologies to ensure objectives are metEnsures project priorities and solutions align with the organization’s strategic directionDevelops project documentation to facilitate sharing of project outcomes and best practicesDrive optimization of user experience leveraging process, people, and technology.Identify and surface items that pose risk and work with teams to mitigate and reduce risk.Engages business leaders to resolve any obstacles which may be encounteredOther duties as assigned

Required Experience

10+ years of program and project management and process improvement experienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.Demonstrated leadership experience within a customer service focused organizationCollaborative approach to decision making on teams.Ability to influence without direct line reporting.Up to 10% travel as needed

Preferred Experience

PMP CertificationSix Sigma Lead methodology training and experienceMasters Degree within a relevant field 

This role can be performed from any office in the US. The pay range for this position is $97k - $137k /yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This position is eligible for an annual bonus and restricted stock unit grant based on individual performance in addition to a full range of benefits outlined here. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via www.paylocity.com/careers.

EEO and accessibility Statement

Paylocity is an equal opportunity employer.

Paylocity is committed to the full inclusion of all individuals. We comply with federal and state disability laws and make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. To request reasonable accommodation in the job application or interview process, please contact accessibility@paylocity.com.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
